meanings.definition: A meeting of members of a political party to select candidates or decide policy.
meanings.sent1: The caucusses gathered to discuss the upcoming election.
meanings.sent2: The local party held caucusses to choose their representative.
meanings.sent3: The caucusses meeting turned into a lively debate about the best candidate.
meanings.sent4: In the sea of opinions, the caucusses acted as a compass guiding the party forward.
meanings.sent5: The colorful banners and enthusiastic cheers made the caucusses unforgettable.

meanings.definition: To hold or form a caucus.
meanings.sent1: She caucusses with her colleagues to plan their strategy.
meanings.sent2: They caucusses regularly to ensure everyone is on the same page.
meanings.sent3: The friends caucusses before making a decision on where to eat.
meanings.sent4: His ability to caucusses effectively made him a respected leader.
meanings.sent5: The team caucusses before every game to boost morale and unity.
